intro: Leucospermum marginatum, commonly known as the coastal candle bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and sandy habitats. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is also valued for its role in supporting local wildlife and its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
